notes.text:
Updated mesa packages that fix multiple security issues are now available
for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

The Red Hat Security Response Team has rated this update as having moderate
security impact. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score,
which gives a detailed severity rating, is available from the CVE link in
the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mesa provides a 3D graphics API that is compatible with Open Graphics
Library (OpenGL). It also provides hardware-accelerated drivers for many
popular graphics chips.

It was found that Mesa did not correctly validate messages from the X
server. A malicious X server could cause an application using Mesa to crash
or, potentially, execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user
running the application. (CVE-2013-1993)

All users of Mesa are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which
contain backported patches to correct these issues. All running
applications linked against Mesa must be restarted for this update to take
effect.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: Multiple integer overflows in X.org libGLX in Mesa 9.1.1 and earlier allow X servers to trigger allocation of insufficient memory and a buffer overflow via vectors related to the (1) XF86DRIOpenConnection and (2) XF86DRIGetClientDriverName functions.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mesa: Multiple integer overflows leading to heap-based bufer overflows
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: Mesa: Multiple integer overflows leading to heap-based bufer overflows
